alert.note: Alert for Chase (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Chase County through 600 PM CDT... At 529 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles southwest of Cottonwood Falls, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cottonwood Falls, Strong City, Bazaar, Elmdale, Tallgrass Prairie and Tallgrass Prairie Preserve. This includes Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 111 and 112. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
